casebody.data:
The Oregon & Transcontinental Co. v. Abraham Kuhn, et al. Decided January 4, 1886. Execeptions by defendants to direction of verdict in favor of plaintiff, ordered to be heard at general term in the first instance. Holmes & Adams, and James C. Carter, for plaintiff. John E. Parsons, for defendants.

Before Sedgwick, Ch. J., Van Vorst and Freedman, JJ.

Opinion

Per Curiam.

Exceptions overruled and judgment ordered for plaintiff upon verdict, with costs.
